item.title: Model.dat maker (delphi console proggy)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

UPDATE :-

Datamaker.zip http://uppit.com/81ACG4
Makes dats from metasequoia files
supports transparency, injection of BLANK triangle priorities and injection of preset animation skin data.
No texture support yet.

RSMI.zip http://uppit.com/YEEQJO
Bentski’s viewer updated to show all model information.
Removed texture support.

Models.zip http://uppit.com/43F2YC
some test models, contains the dat specification for the older format.

SOURCE : http://uppit.com/CDWW0N
Just for fun.

www.kaspersky.com/scanforvirus

Frank - learn some logic, better ==== bigger != better ==> bigger

item.title: Model.dat maker (delphi console proggy)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yes, it’s got 8k black values, 8k white values and the rest is colour.

do you know what a lookup table is?

having the pointer contain the information needed to calculate the values within a lookup table defeats the whole point of using a lookup table.

You realise with a better lookup table you could have used custom colours for the interface, more player colors and better gradients?

Read full topic

item.title: Model.dat maker (delphi console proggy)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

…coz the color model and data storage is retarded.?

HSL stored bitwise HHHHHHSS SLLLLLLL ??? WHY???

Oh it’s jagexs propriatoryoritory ‘compression’.

It’s a fucking JOKE, if they stored the vertex load flags and triangle types bitwise, they could have used R,G,B or H,S,V values and still saved on file space and bandwidth.
I hope they wasted their money on a patent. (can’t find one though)

Seriously, a search ‘seemed’ the best option… till i worked it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Model.dat maker (delphi console proggy)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Updated :-
Used benski’s interface to make it easier.
Now loads .mqo files (rounds the floating points, makes modelling easier)
Now exports .mqo files correctly.
Automatically calculates the nearest RScolor number from the R,G,B numbers. (doesn’t search, it works 'em out)
Injects blank anim data if needed.

TODO:
Test for alpha values < 1.0, inject alpha values automatically if needed.
Inject Anim numbers for standard models like swords, shields, hats, etc…

Source code posted in first post…

Suggestions welcome.

Read full topic

item.title: Model.dat maker (delphi console proggy)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You know thats only slightly funny?
made me chuckle though

I’ll post some more helpful dribble below, the proggy is really for those that understand the file format and might be able to use the code in their own programs.

Begin dribble;

dat maker notes.
model vertices MUST be integer values.
The model space extents are approx +/- 32,000
The material colors can be calculated from bentskis rsmv.
The program attempts to traverse the model triangle by triangle, in the order the triangles are written to file. SEE compression notes.

metasequoia specific notes.
In metasequoia set the grid to 1, click move button, move vertex to new point and back again to remove any non integer values.
Might be wise to keep large models in ortho mode.

compression notes. (Google 3D compression)
You can use metasequoia to compress the model.
Compression is simply about creating a single 'net '(or as few as possible).
Much like peeling an orange, you can peel it in a single strip or remove lots of smaller pieces.
You can trick metasequoia into writing triangles to file in the order you want them to be, triangles are usually written in order of creation.
select the starting triangle, cut and paste, then the next triangle cut and paste…continue until finished.
your triangles will be put into seperate objects and the first triangle will be at the top of the list.
You should now have an empty object and lots of objects with 1 triangle.
Select the original object and ‘merge all’ (under the misc button)
The triangles will now be written in the way you ordered them.
Remove extra vertex points with the join closed vertices command and save.
Takes about 10 minutes to do, but may take hours trying to figure out which is the best compression path.
Compression is entirely optional.

End dribble;

You might notice that face type 4 in the client isn’t used, simply because it isn’t needed - EVER.

More proof that jagex employs retards - model 16741

Edit: Why do i fucking bother?

Read full topic
